titleStmt.title: G. W. Gwin to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7448

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his Excellency Thos E. Bramlett Governor of Kentucky -- The undersigned a Justice of the peace for Franklin County would respectfully represent that at the Decr. Term 1865. of his Court there was adjudged against Richard Crutcher and Washington Crutcher fines amounting to $20 exclusive of Costs for failing to work on road in precinct No 2 in this County two days with their hands -- Altho I felt bound from the testimony to inflict the fine, yet there are some extenuating Circumstances -- these Can be related to your excellency by Mr. Crutcher the bearer of this petition who respectfully requests and desires a remission of the fines by your honor -- Whatever representation Mr Crutcher may make to you may be Strictly relied on --

Respy
G W Gwin J. P.

Franklin Co
Justice Court
vs
Richd & Washington Crutcher
for $20,
Remitted 15 Dec /65
